intro: Acer monspessulanum subsp. ibericum, commonly known as the Iberian maple, is a deciduous tree native to the Iberian Peninsula. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a rounded crown and smooth, gray bark. The leaves are palmately lobed, with a serrated margin, and turn vibrant shades of red and orange in autumn. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in early spring before the leaves emerge. The tree is well adapted to Mediterranean climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
